result.execSummary:
The defendant Javonte M Cotton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: STRAIGHT TIME, Consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 15 days. No good time.
Concurrent with: CONCURRENT with current term of probation.

miscConds.notes:
Provide DNA sample if not previously done so- pay surcharge;
Pay all applicable mandatory surcharges, costs, fees, and assessments by the end of supervision period or any remaining balance shall convert to civil judgment.

Seek and maintain employment.
Participate in job and vocational training.
Mental health assessment; treatment; if needed.

Absolute sobriety- no controlled substances or alcohol.
AODA assessment; treatment, if needed.
Urine screens.

timeConds.notes: straight time, no good time- STAYED for use at agent's discretion.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Javonte M Cotton

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Javonte M Cotton in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested a plea and sentencing date.  Court granted defense request, ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue, and ordered case adjourned for plea and sentencing before Branch 20.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Original Transcript (13 pages) PRELIMINARY HEARING commencing MAY 13, 2015 received and filed.
Court orders other terms and conditions to remain the same.

Stipulation to a bail modification is agreed upon by the parties and approved by the court.
Court orders bail AMENDED to a $500.00 SIGNATURE BOND.

Defendant Javonte M Cotton in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Javonte M Cotton in custody.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Matthew Leidy-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION. Court ordered defendnt to be monitored by Drug Testing.

Defendant Javonte M Cotton in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Javonte M Cotton in custody.  
Katryna L. Childs appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  
Motion to dismiss by defense argued and DENIED by the Court.
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. 
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Javonte M Cotton
Current: 8329 W Carmen Ave #4, Milwaukee, WI 53218   (Effective: 05-03-2015)
Prior: 4933 N 105th St, Milwaukee, WI 53225
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
